subject: Cybersecurity
title: Hacktivism: Hacking for a Cause
description: A quick, practical guide to Hacktivism: Hacking for a Cause.

hook.text: Anonymous took down government websites to protest censorship. Heroes to some, criminals to others.

buildup.text: Hacktivism uses hacking to promote political causes: DDoS attacks on oppressive governments, leaking.

discovery.text: Anonymous, LulzSec, and WikiLeaks blurred the line between digital protest and cybercrime in the 2010s.

twist.text: Sabu, Anonymous's leader, was secretly working as an FBI informant. He helped arrest his own members.

climax.text: Hacktivism raises a hard question: when the system is unjust, is breaking the law through hacking morally justified?

punchline.text: Anonymous's leader was working for the FBI all along.

quiz.question: What was Sabu's role in Anonymous?
options: He was the group's main programmer
He was a leader who secretly became an FBI informant and helped arrest other members
He founded the group and left voluntarily
